column2: Eutrophication potential: 0.65 g P-eq/kg, [=] 0.00065 tonne P/tonne
A gallon (3.8 liters) of ice cream must weigh at least 4.5 pounds, making the minimum density 0.54 gram per 	 	milliliter.
It takes 3:1 Milk:IceCream by volume, so factor in that ice cream has a density of 0.54 tonne/m^3,
then 3 m^3 of milk would make 1 m^3 of ice cream, weight 0.54 tonne, or:
